name: China Rose
climate: China Rose thrives in a warm, subtropical climate with plenty of sunshine.
This plant prefers climates with moderate humidity and minimal frost risk.
It can tolerate hot and humid conditions but struggles in extreme cold.
Ideal climate includes mild winters and warm, humid summers for optimal growth.
sunlight: China Rose requires full sunlight for at least six hours a day to bloom well.
Partial shade can be tolerated, especially in hotter regions, to prevent leaf scorch.
Insufficient sunlight can lead to reduced flowering and lankier growth.
Morning sunlight with afternoon shade can help it in achieving optimal health.
watering: Regular watering is necessary to keep the soil evenly moist but not soggy.
Allow the top inch of soil to dry out between waterings to avoid overwatering.
In hotter months, more frequent watering is needed to prevent wilting.
Reduce watering during winter to avoid root rot caused by excess moisture.
soil: China Rose prefers well-draining, fertile soil rich in organic matter.
A slightly acidic to neutral soil pH between 6.0 and 7.0 is ideal for growth.
Heavy clay soils should be amended with compost to improve drainage and aeration.
Soil should retain moisture but offer good drainage to prevent waterlogging.
extra_care_tip: Prune regularly to structure the plant and promote bushier growth.
Deadhead spent blooms to encourage continuous flowering throughout the season.
